thread.title: Ground News - Stowaway found in airplane undercarriage at Paris airport in critical condition: source
thread.title_full: Ground News - Stowaway found in airplane undercarriage at Paris airport in critical condition: source

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Stowaway found in airplane undercarriage at Paris airport in critical condition: source
text:
Summary by Ground News Man found alive in the undercarriage bay during technical checks. Air Algerie flight from Oran, Algeria, landed at Paris Orly airport on Thursday. He is believed to be in his 20s but had no ID on him, and was taken to a nearby hospital in a serious condition. Share menu More
Filters 34 Articles 34 Articles All Left Center Right
CTV News Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Bell Media Stowaway found in airplane undercarriage at Paris airport in critical condition: source A stowaway was found alive but in critical condition in the undercarriage bay of an Air Algeria airplane at Paris Orly airport on Thursday morning, a security source briefed on the matter told Reuters.
5 hours ago · Canada Read Full Article
CTV News Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Bell Media
Stowaway found in airplane undercarriage at Paris airport in critical condition: source A stowaway was found alive but in critical condition in the undercarriage bay of an Air Algeria airplane at Paris Orly airport on Thursday morning, a security source briefed on the matter told Reuters.

An airport source said the unidentified man was in a ‘life-threatening’ condition.

5 hours ago · Kobbegem, Belgium Read Full Article Noticias ao Minuto Young man found in “hypothermia” on plane landing gear in Paris A young man was discovered, this Thursday, “in severe hypothermia” at Paris-Orly Airport, on the landing gear of an airplane coming from Algeria. The information was provided by AFP, which cites sources at the airport. “A young man was discovered near the landing train upon the arrival of a flight from Oran,” said one of the sources, on condition of anonymity. The young man, in his early twenties, was “alive, but in a situation of absolute emerg…
